UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The Kingdom of Vaynar has formed a small, but capable army. Their greatest strength is their discipline, experience and bravery - results of decades of constant battle with the undead.

UnitType.Description: The Redwatch are good early skirmishers, quick to train and good in most battles. They learn faster than other faction's warriors and can become experienced units after only a few battles.

UnitType.Description: The Blades of Athica are good midgame units for your armies. Though they receive little special training many heroes have risen from their number.

UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.

UnitType.Description: Use Explorers to explore the world. Vaynar Explorers take longer to train but they last longer than the scouts of other factions.

UnitType.Description: Cheap and effective early unit.
UnitType.Backstory: First used in desperation, when manpower was sorely needed, the Forgiven units were formed from prisoners and the poor, being promissed a pardon or a better lot in life. A religious undercurrent of fanaticism quickly spread trough and the new units were thrown into battle with only a weapon and whatever pathetic excuse for armor the men themselves could scrounge up. They were never expected to survive, just to tie up the enemy and take a few with them. And fall they did, but not before reaping a bloody toll so large the enemy ranks collapsed. Today, the units of forgiven have a bleak, death-acceptance philosophy and throw themselves at the enemy without fear, beliveing that they will earn their salvation with death - either the enemeis or their own.

UnitType.Description: Cheap and effective early unit.
UnitType.Backstory: The Vanguards are a well-known backbone of the Kingdom of Vaynar. In many ways similar to the Forgiven (and it's not unusual that pardoned forgiven serve in the unit), the Vangaurds defend key positions or storm enemy lines armed with a greatsword. Unlike the forgivem they expect to survive, and being a proper army unit, get proper armor.

UnitType.Description: Core mid-game unit.
UnitType.Backstory: The Veterans are the most feared units deployed by the Kingom of Vaynar. They rely on their experience and skill more than on expensive equiment, making them a good choce for a sovereign lacking in magical resources.

UnitType.Description: Mages deal magical damage at range, use them to decimate enemies that rely on physical defense.
UnitType.Backstory: Archmages show far greater mastery in magical art, and are usually required to create their own magical staves.

UnitType.Description: Mages deal magical damage at range, use them to decimate enemies that rely on physical defense.
UnitType.Backstory: Archmages show far greater mastery in magical art, and are usually required to create their own magical staves.

UnitType.Description: Horsemen are excellent for scouting out unknown areas, and escaping when they uncover dangers in those areas.
UnitType.Backstory: The purpose of light cavalry is to ride in quickly where it is needed and deliver a heavy blow. They prefer lighter armor and carry warhammers or maces.

UnitType.Description: Knights are heavy front-line mounted troops.
UnitType.Backstory: Grand Knights are there to break trough enemy lines and run down the stragglers. They wear heavy armor but still retain good mobility theanks to their warhorses.

UnitType.Description: Knights are heavy front-line mounted troops.
UnitType.Backstory: Grand Knights are there to break trough enemy lines and run down the stragglers. Unlike many other mounted knights, they don't carry a full set of heavy armor, but rather only cover the most vital areas (torso and head), as they value initiative and mobility.

UnitType.Description: The Kingdom of Vaynar has formed a small, but capable army. Their greatest strength is their discipline, experience and bravery - results of decades of constant battle with the undead.
UnitType.Backstory: In the darkest days of the vaynaran people, when beset by undead and monsters from all sides, everyone capable of holding a weapon was called to fight. The women were used mostly in suport roles and as harrasers and they proved formidable in those roles. The best and most experienced female archers of Vaynar formed a unit known as Hawkeyes, which quickly rose to fame inside the kingdom. Their speed and accuracy enable them to harass enemy troops or supply lines or pick off important targets.

UnitType.Description: Spearmen are effective against well armored enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: The women of the kingdom of Vaynar are no strangers to war. Decades of fighting the undead hordes has made them into capable warriors. Equipped with only light armor, they rely on their agility to perform hit-and-run attacks, striking fast and hard. One would have to be a fool to underestimate them. These valkyrires relish in fighting strong opponents. More than one monster found it's end confused, as the Sentinels dodged it's blow only to strike it in the vitals with lighting speed.

UnitType.Description: Armed with great weapons and clad in fine armor, the Templars will cleave a path trough any battlefield with zeal.
UnitType.Background: The Kingdom of Vaynar has formed a small, but capable army. Their greatest strength is their discipline, experience and bravery - results of decades of constant battle with the undead. The templars have mastered the use of greatswords and will carve a bloody path into the enemy ranks with zeal. Humble Templars are armed with normal weapons and armor.

UnitType.Description: Armed with great weapons and clad in fine armor, the Templars will cleave a path trough any battlefield with zeal.
UnitType.Background: The Kingdom of Vaynar has formed a small, but capable army. Their greatest strength is their discipline, experience and bravery - results of decades of constant battle with the undead. The templars have mastered the use of greatswords and will carve a bloody path into the enemy ranks with zeal.

UnitType.Description: Powerfull melee units.
UnitType.Background: The Kingdom of Vaynar has formed a small, but capable army. Their greatest strength is their discipline, experience and bravery - results of decades of constant battle with the undead.The Crusaders are veteran units, skilled knights who fight with sword and shield. The Humble Crusaders use normal weapons and armor.

UnitType.Description: Powerfull melee units.
UnitType.Background: The Kingdom of Vaynar has formed a small, but capable army. Their greatest strength is their discipline, experience and bravery - results of decades of constant battle with the undead.The Crusaders are veteran units, skilled knights who fight with sword and shield.

UnitType.Description: Paladins are the most expensive and powerfull units that can be trained. These blessed warriors combine the best armor, weapons and enchanted items with advanced training and unshakable faith.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am the eyes of the king, and His voice!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The court mage of Vaynar and chief advisor to Ellderon, Avernuses knowledge of lore both mundane and mystical is wast and deep.

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: "There is much darkness in this world, so many dangers and monsters that prey on the innocents. My order, the Order of Holy Fire, dedicates itself to making this world a better place. To cleanse this world of all the monsters, to give the race of men hope. That is my mission, my duty. And only in death will my duty end. Untill then I will fight with everything I have. And at your side if you will have me."

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The arcane powers heed my call. They can be yours, just say the word and I will command them.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: "I was trained by the great Avernus himself. I cherish those days of learning, they seem so peacefull and worry-free, as if from a different world that the one I find myself in now. My training is over, and my power grows daily. Time to put it to use and bring peace to these lands!"

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I welcome a challenge, and you seem destiend to great things. Which means great opposition. My spear is yours.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: "What is there to say about me? I was once A Sentinel. Led a whole squad trough many skirmishes. Me and my girls were getting quite a reputation. But I got to careless. Too arrogant. Engaged a drake without waiting for support. Killed the drake, but lost my unit and almost my life. I figure it's better for someone else to lead."
